result.execSummary:
The defendant Terressa M Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken in prescribed doses.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:09 p.m.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  8/5/22, 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:10 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Terressa M Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Terressa M Harris. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-29-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

1:53 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Terressa M Harris in court.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing in court with the defendant.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 04-11-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess THC (2nd +) and felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
